law.catch_line: Liability insurance for Kentucky National Guard members on active state duty.
law.text: The Adjutant General may purchase liability insurance for the protection of members of the Kentucky National Guard called to state active duty by the Governor under KRS 38.030 to protect them for acts, omissions, and claims arising while on state active duty, and while not otherwise covered by existing state government programs that provide medical coverage or protection for acts, omissions, or claims to members of the Kentucky National Guard while on state active duty. To provide coverage not provided by existing state government programs, the Adjutant General may purchase the type and amount of liability coverage deemed appropriate to best serve the interests of the Kentucky National Guard and its members.
law.history: Created 1998 Ky. Acts ch. 516, sec. 1, effective July 15, 1998.
